meanings.definition: A sudden decline or loss of power or status.
meanings.sent1: The king's downfall came swiftly after the rebellion.
meanings.sent2: The downfall of the company was due to poor management decisions.
meanings.sent3: The clown's downfall was slipping on a banana peel during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The downfall of the once mighty empire was inevitable.
meanings.sent5: The downfall of the hero made the story even more tragic.

meanings.definition: A cause of ruin or destruction.
meanings.sent1: Neglecting maintenance was the downfall of the old building.
meanings.sent2: Greed proved to be the downfall of the character in the story.
meanings.sent3: The downfall of the sandcastle was the mischievous wave.
meanings.sent4: The downfall of the evil villain was his own arrogance.
meanings.sent5: The downfall of the plan was the lack of preparation.

meanings.sent1: The downfall of the leaf was gentle as it floated to the ground.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster's thrilling downfall brought screams of excitement.
meanings.sent3: The downfall of the ball down the stairs was noisy but funny.
meanings.sent4: The downfall of the rain was a welcome relief after the drought.
meanings.sent5: The downfall of the snow from the tree branches was a beautiful sight.
